item.title: HELP? | | Making anything send a .txt to your server folder? Rep+++++!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Nope, now I get this error.

This is the code without errors. It works fine.
(Other than the ITEMID not coming up.)

if (droppedItem == 19928) { deleteItem(19928, 1); BufferedWriter bw = null; String Path = "./ItemsDropped.txt"; try { bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(Path, true)); try { bw.write(playerName+": +getItemName(removeID)+"); bw.newLine(); } finally { bw.close(); } } catch (final IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } }

item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

No, I changed it again.

It works now, other than this coming up in the ItemDropped.txt file.

Owner Bob: getItemName(removeID)+ Owner Bob: +getItemName(removeID)+

As you can see I tried it with the + on both ends but it still won’t come up with the item ID.

Any ideas?

@lostmyphat wrote:

[quote=“JGX, post:5, topic:422599”][quote] if (droppedItem == 19928) {
deleteItem(19928, 1);
BufferedWriter bw = null;
final String suggestion = command.substring(8);
String Path = “./ItemsDropped.txt”;
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(Path, true));
try {
bw.write(playerName+": "+itemid);
bw.newLine();
} finally {
bw.close();
}
} catch (final IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

[/quote]

I get this error from that.

and I got the second issue taken care of.[/quote]
Case sensitiveeeeee

item.title: HELP? | | Making anything send a .txt to your server folder? Rep+++++!
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Can you stop centering everything, it’s freaking annoying as hell and hard to read.

	if (droppedItem == 19928) {
		deleteItem(19928, 1);
		BufferedWriter bw = null;
		final String suggestion = command.substring(8);
		String Path = "./ItemsDropped.txt";
		try {
			bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(Path, true));
			try {
				bw.write(playerName+": "+itemid);
				bw.newLine();
			} finally {
				bw.close();
			}
		} catch (final IOException ioe) {
			ioe.printStackTrace();
		}
	}

Just why…

if (command.startsWith("sale") && playerHasItem(4716, 1))){ deleteItem(4716, getItemSlot(4716), 1); deleteItem(4720, getItemSlot(4720), 1); addItem(995, 5000000); addItem(995, 6000000); }
